lead_paragraph: “Of course I would accept a clear election result, but I would also reserve my right to contest or file a legal challenge in the case of a questionable result,” Mr. Trump said.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Ashley Parker, Amy Chozick, Trip Gabriel and Thomas Kaplan.
byline.original: By ALAN RAPPEPORT and ALEXANDER BURNS

headline.print_headline: Trump Stays Firm on Having Option to Dispute Vote
headline.main: Donald Trump Says He Will Accept Election Outcome (‘if I Win’)

snippet: “Of course I would accept a clear election result, but I would also reserve my right to contest or file a legal challenge in the case of a questionable result,” Mr. Trump said....
abstract: Donald Trump insists that he will reserve his right to contest outcome of presidential election, despite concerns from across political spectrum that his statements undermine American tradition of peaceful transfer of power; Trump suggests he will not dispute election if outcome is clear, even as he roils his supporters with campaign speeches focusing on conspiracy theories about election being fixed.
